revised_title: Sir Richard Bulkley's Experiments on Maize: An Improvement in Agriculture
tldr: Sir Richard Bulkley's experiments with maize yield promising results, potentially replacing the cultivation of field white peas due to its high yield and nutritional value. He also describes the plant's growth and fruiting process, as well as its various uses in cooking. John Ray adds a note on the letter, discussing the two distinct species of maize and their cultivation.
